other_tests.findings: Normal, with no evidence of valvular vegetations.

Malrotation of the left extrarenal pelvis, multiple cortical defects in the left kidney consistent with scarring, urinary catheter in the urethra, mildly enlarged spleen (14.8 cm), prominent lymph nodes, and trace free fluid in the pelvis.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Persistent mild splenomegaly with peripheral wedge-shaped areas of hypoattenuation consistent with infarcts.

other_tests.procedure_name: CT scan of the abdomen after intravenous administration of contrast
other_tests.findings: Multiple wedge-shaped areas of hypoenhancement in the periphery of the spleen consistent with splenic infarcts.

other_tests.procedure_name: Ultrasonography of kidneys and lower extremities
other_tests.findings: Normal, with no evidence of hydronephrosis or deep venous thrombosis.
Presence of IgM antibodies against viral capsid antigen and the absence of IgG antibodies, indicating acute EBV infection.
other_tests.changes_over_time: 10 months later, IgG antibodies against viral capsid antigen and EBV nuclear antigen were present, indicating seroconversion.
